name: Google Drive modules
title: Google Drive modules

children.text: After connecting to the Google Drive app, you can use the following modules to build your
Triggers when a file is created or modified in a selected folder.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select whether you want to watch new files in the folder (By Created Time) or modified files (By Modified Time).
Select whether you want to watch files in one of the following locations:
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Select the Folder to be Watched
Navigate to the folder you want to watch.
Select file type to filter watched files by.
Set the maximum number of files Make will return during one execution cycle.
Triggers when a file is created or modified.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select whether you want to watch new files in the folder (By Created Time), or modified files (By Modified Time).

This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Select file type to filter watched files by.
Set the maximum number of files Make will return during one execution cycle.
Triggers when a new folder is created or modified.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select whether you want to watch new folders (By Created Time), or modified folders (By Modified Time)

This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Navigate to the folder you want to watch for the folders.
Set the maximum number of folders Make will return during one execution cycle.
Searches for files or folders based on search criteria.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select the location where you want to search for files or folders:
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
You can limit search scope to include files or folders within the selected folder or to search everywhere. If no folder is chosen, it defaults to the root folder.
Navigate to the folder you want to search for the files or folders.
Select whether you want to search for files, folders, or both.
Select the type of the search you want to perform.
Enter the query (differs based on the search type selected in the

Search within file/folder names: Enter a part of the file name or full file name (including the suffix) you want to search.  Select whether you want to search exact term or search the file/folder name that contains the entered term in the Search Options field below.
Full text search: Enter any search term you want search in your Google Drive.

Enter custom search query: Enter the custom search query.  Add the folder selected above to the query Searches for the folder n the parents collection. This finds all files and folders located directly in the folder selected above.
Set the maximum number of files or folders Make will return during one execution cycle.
Downloads a file from your Google Drive.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select the location where you want to download a file:
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Select whether you want to enter (map) the file ID manually or select the file using the menu.
Enter (map) the file ID of the file you want to download.
Convert Google Documents/Spreadsheets/Slides/Drawings Files to Format
Select the file type of the file you want to download and target file type you want convert to the file to.
Creates a file from plain text.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select the location where you want to create the file:
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Select the target location where you want to create the new file.
Enter the name for the new file.
Enter the plain text content of the new file.
Convert the File to Google Docs Document

data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Select the location where you want to create the folder:
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.
Select the target location where you want to create the new folder.
Enter the name for the new folder.
If enabled, the folder is shared to anyone with the link of the folder (Web View Link). Otherwise the Web View Link works for the owners only.
Select permission for the folder. A permission grants a user, group, domain, or the world access to a folder hierarchy.
Select the role to define what users can do with a file or folder. For the list of operations users can perform for each role please refer to the
Creates a new file or folder shortcut.

data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: This option is available for Google Workspace users only.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

Data: Enter the file data manually.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

File name, including the extension, e.g.
Enter (map) the data of the file you want to update.
Select whether to retain the revision.
You can retain only 200 revisions for the file forever. If the limit is reached, you need to delete pinned revisions.

Permanently deletes a file or folder. The file or folder is deleted permanently without moving it to trash.

The notification email with the link will be sent to the specified email address.
Enter the expiration time. The expiration time must be future and cannot be more than a year in the future.

data.label: Google Drive

children.text: Enter (map) the ID or select the drive you want to retrieve details about.
Updates an existing drive's name and/or restrictions. For admins only.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Enter (map) the ID or select the drive you want to update.
Enter the new name for the shared drive.
Enable or disable restrictions that apply to this shared drive or items inside this shared drive.
Admin Managed Restrictions: Select whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

Copy Requires Writer Permission: Select whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is enabled, it will override the similarly named field to true for any file inside this shared drive.

Domain Users Only: Select whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this shared drive.
Drive Members Only: Select whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

data.label: Google Drive
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Drive account

children.text: Enter (map) the ID or select the drive you want to delete.

children.text: Select whether you want to enter (map) the file ID manually or select the file using the menu.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

children.text: Select whether you want to enter (map) the file ID manually or select the file using the menu.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.
Select or map the shared drive whose file's revision you want to update
Enter the File ID whose revision you want to update.
Enter the Revision ID you want to update.

Select whether to keep this revision forever, even if it is no longer the head revision. If not set, the revision will automatically purge 30 days after newer content is uploaded. You can set a maximum of 200 revisions for a file. This applies only to files with binary content in Drive.
Select whether to republish subsequent revisions automatically. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.
Select whether this revision is published. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.
Select whether this revision is published outside the domain. This is only applicable to Docs Editors files.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

Select whether you want to watch new comments (
This option is available for Google Workspace users only.

Set the maximum number of comments Make will return during one execution cycle.
Get a Folder ID for a Path
Retrieves a folder ID for a folder path.

It is not recommended to have subfolders with the same name inside one folder.

, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

Allows you to perform a custom API call.
Establish a connection to your Google drive account.
For the list of available endpoints, refer to the
Select the HTTP method you want to use:
GET to retrieve information for an entry.
POST to create a new entry.
PUT to update/replace an existing entry.
PATCH to make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.
The following API call returns all files in your Google Drive:
The result can be found in the module's Output under Bundle > Body > files. In our example, 30 files were returned:

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
